system.description:
You have both made stark improvements to your personal siege weapon, and developed new, even greater weapons of near total destruction, gaining the following benefits:

  • When using your personal siege weapon, you have learned to load it with specialized ammunition. You may load it with alchemist's fire, an acid flask, or a single black powder charge.  On a hit it deals normal damage plus the additional effect of the loaded item.  Alchemist's fire and acid flask function as if you had hit with them, black powder charge immediately detonates on a hit with the area centered on the target of the attack.
  • In addition, you develop three extra powerful but extra complex personal siege weapons.  These take 10 minutes to setup or stow, and while operating one your movement speed is reduced to 5 ft per round, and these weapons require both hands to operate.  You develop all three, though you may not always have all three with you. They each weigh 100 lbs and count as a bulky item.  They cannot be loaded with additional specialized ammunition as above.  They otherwise count as a personal siege weapon for you.
    • Reflective Death Ray: This weapon can only be used outdoors in sunny conditions, or in places with a similarly bright source of unobstructed light (such as can be found on some other planes or generated by certain magical sources such as the daylight or sunbeam spell).  If the source powering it counts as sunlight, so do attacks with the ray. As an action, you may create a beam of focused light 60 ft. long and 5 ft wide.  Creatures in the area must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.  On a failed save they take 6d8 radiant damage, and on a successful save they take half.  The ray cannot move and fire in the same round, as it must be recalibrated to refocus the light.
    • Ratcheting Heavy Arbalest: This functions as a heavy arbalest, except it may preload up to 15 shots at a time.  Loading it takes an action, and while so loaded it may fire as if it did not have the loading property.  Alternatively, you may expend all preloaded bolts in one round as an action.  If you do so, you create a 90 ft cone.  Creatures that enter that cone or start their turn in it must make a dexterity saving throw, taking 2d10 on a failed save or half on a success, and the area of the cone is difficult terrain until the start of your next turn.
    • Alchemist's Dragon: This weapon can use an action to spray alchemist's fire in a 60 ft cone.  Creatures in the area must make a dexterity save with a DC of 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence modifier.  On a failed save, they take 4d6 fire damage and begin taking ongoing fire damage as if they were hit by alchemist's fire, using the normal DC for the item.  On a success, they take half damage and do not catch on fire.  It also ignites unattended flammable objects in the area.  Each shot uses 5 flasks worth of alchemist's fire as ammunition.
